messages.title: My plan for Glasgow and Rutherglen/Cambuslang
Robert Brown's Story
messages.content: Robert was born in Newcastle, brought up in Aberdeenshire and is a graduate of Aberdeen University. A qualified solicitor, he worked as a Procurator Fiscal Depute in Dumbarton before being a senior partner in a large legal firm. A long-time resident of Rutherglen, Robert was four times elected to Glasgow District Council. Between 1999 and 2011, he served as an MSP for Glasgow Region. He was also Depute Minister for Education and Young People (2005-7) and Convener of the Cross Party Groups on visual impairment, human rights, and children and young people.

messages.title: Make a real difference HELP ROBERT WIN

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Improving school standards, more college places, high quality apprenticeships, universities free of government interference.
Higher quality mental health services, more local GP and consultant services, less bureaucracy, more local services.
A secure Scotland in a federal Britain to unite the country after the referendum.

politicalExperience.role: Depute Minister for Education and Young People
Convener of the Cross Party Groups on visual impairment, human rights, and children and young people

images.caption: We called to see you today
